property.name: mediadisplayblurb
property.value: Aerial view of flooding in Pakistan

note.text: Pakistan suffers from frequent floods and earthquakes. Flooding is most common along the Indus River, especially in July and August. In 2007, floods damaged nearly 2 million houses. About 20% of the country's land was underwater in 2010.

Earthquakes are most frequent in the north and west. A major quake in 2005 killed at least 75,000 people and left hundreds of thousands homeless. In October 2015, a quake in Afghanistan of similar size killed several hundred Pakistanis and destroyed thousands of homes.
